newsitem.title: USA: Metatools to acquire Real Time Geometry.
newsitem.headline: Metatools to acquire Real Time Geometry.

text.p: MetaTools Inc said on Monday that it entered an agreement to buy Real Time Geometry Corp in a stock deal.

MetaTools plans to issue 1.36 million shares of MetaTools' common stock in exchange for all the outstanding shares of Real Time, a Princeton, N.J.-based company specializing in real-time, 3-D graphics and visualization technologies.
MetaTools will also issue about 800,000 non-qualified stock options to purchase MetaTools common stock to current Real Time employees.
The acquisition is expected to close by December 31, 1996.

If the common stock of MetaTools on the closing date is $14.50 per share -- the closing price on December 20, 1996 -- then MetaTools would expect to charge about $17 million against earnings during the fourth quarter ended December 31, 1996.
The charges are related to the write-off of research and development in-process at Real Time and other costs related to the transaction.
